Class DatabaseTransaction

LMDB Transaction that allows creating or opening databases. Only one of these can be active in the environment at a time.

Syntax
public class DatabaseTransaction : Transaction, IDisposable

Methods

Committed()

Called at end of commit, at this point the transaction is already closed/disposed.

Declaration
protected override void Committed()
Overrides
Transaction.Committed()

OpenDatabase(String, DatabaseConfiguration)

Open a database in the environment. A database handle denotes the name and parameters of a database, independently of whether such a database exists. The database handle may be discarded by calling mdb_dbi_close(). The old database handle is returned if the database was already open. The handle may only be closed once. The database handle will be private to the current transaction until the transaction is successfully committed. If the transaction is aborted the handle will be closed automatically. After a successful commit the handle will reside in the shared environment, and may be used by other transactions. This function must not be called from multiple concurrent transactions in the same process. A transaction that uses this function must finish (either commit or abort) before any other transaction in the process may use this function. To use named databases(with name != NULL), mdb_env_set_maxdbs() must be called before opening the environment. Database names are keys in the unnamed database, and may be read but not written.

Declaration
public Database OpenDatabase(string name, DatabaseConfiguration config)
Parameters
Type Name Description
String name

Database name. Can be null for the default database.
DatabaseConfiguration config

Database configuration instance.
Returns
Type Description
Database

OpenFixedMultiValueDatabase(String, FixedMultiValueDatabaseConfiguration)

Open a fixed multi-value database in the environment. Each value must have the same size. A database handle denotes the name and parameters of a database, independently of whether such a database exists. The database handle may be discarded by calling mdb_dbi_close(). The old database handle is returned if the database was already open. The handle may only be closed once. The database handle will be private to the current transaction until the transaction is successfully committed. If the transaction is aborted the handle will be closed automatically. After a successful commit the handle will reside in the shared environment, and may be used by other transactions. This function must not be called from multiple concurrent transactions in the same process. A transaction that uses this function must finish (either commit or abort) before any other transaction in the process may use this function. To use named databases(with name != NULL), mdb_env_set_maxdbs() must be called before opening the environment. Database names are keys in the unnamed database, and may be read but not written.

OpenMultiValueDatabase(String, MultiValueDatabaseConfiguration)

Open a multi-value database in the environment. A database handle denotes the name and parameters of a database, independently of whether such a database exists. The database handle may be discarded by calling mdb_dbi_close(). The old database handle is returned if the database was already open. The handle may only be closed once. The database handle will be private to the current transaction until the transaction is successfully committed. If the transaction is aborted the handle will be closed automatically. After a successful commit the handle will reside in the shared environment, and may be used by other transactions. This function must not be called from multiple concurrent transactions in the same process. A transaction that uses this function must finish (either commit or abort) before any other transaction in the process may use this function. To use named databases(with name != NULL), mdb_env_set_maxdbs() must be called before opening the environment. Database names are keys in the unnamed database, and may be read but not written.

ReleaseManagedResources(Boolean)

Releases/closes managed resources - like cursors - owned by the transaction. Thread-safe. Part of Dispose() pattern.

Declaration
protected override void ReleaseManagedResources(bool forCommit = false)
Parameters
Type Name Description
Boolean forCommit

true if transaction is closed/disposed due to a commit, false otherwise.
Overrides
Transaction.ReleaseManagedResources(Boolean)
